intro: Cissampelos senensis, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its roots and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in herbal remedies. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments.
